results.title: The House fly
results.creator_credit: William A. Anderson and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: House flies may be found almost everywhere that man lives. They are the carriers of germs which cause many serious diseases. Using magnified illustrations of structural details, the film describes the feeding and digestive systems and breeding habits. The details of their structure and life history explained - why the house fly is such a menace to health. The film concludes with sanitation procedures necessary to control the house fly menace.

results.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
results.creator_credit: Graham Evans, William Stirling and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes is enlisted by Dr Mortimer to investigate the case in which one of his patients, Sir Charles, appeared to die from terror. Originating from the Baskerville family, the lineage includes the infamy of Sir Hugo Baskerville who died after having this throat torn out - the woman he was pursuing died from shock after witnessing the incident. Since then, legend has perpetuated of a monstrous dog prowling the moors and of the numerous family members who have lost their lives to the mysterious canine. Inheriting the property on Charles’ death Sir Henry, a cautious Mortimer, is not so sure Charles’ safety can be ensured given the history at the manor and Holmes places Watson there to keep an eye on proceedings. Dramatised by Hugh Leonard, Peter Cushing stars as Sherlock Holmes in the novel by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, first published in “The Strand” in 1901/1902 and in novel form in 1902. Cast also includes Gary Raymond, Gabriella Licudi, Philip Bond, Gerald Flood.

results.title: The Hot head
results.brief_description: The problems of efficient fuel consumption in the automobile engine. Laboratory tests demonstrate complete and incomplete combustion of carbon; the influence of engine design on combustion efficiency; efficient burning through atomisation of fuel; design of the valve-in-head for maximum combustion and minimum power wastage; movement of the fuel mixture; removal of gases and control of the fuel mixture.

results.title: The Hospital
results.brief_description: Depicts the many departments and services to be found in a hospital. Explains the work of different staff members and illustrates what is involved in diagnosing an illness and caryring out the necessary medical treatment. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Horse and its relatives
results.creator_credit: Chicago Zoological Society and Coronet Productions
results.brief_description: The horse and has been tamed and used by humans since the days of antiquity. In this film several of the animals b iologically related to the horse are studied, with emphasis on their physical characteristics and their habits in their natural surroundings - the zebra, the South American tapir, and the rhinoceros. These animals are very rarely tamed. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.

results.title: The Horror of it all
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Traces the history and development of the horror film from the beginning of the century up to the 1970’s. The film combines fascinating and rare footage from European and American horror films with a look at changes and recurring themes in these works. Narrated by Jose Ferrer.

results.title: The Hooley-Dooleys: pop
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley and Hooley Dooleys Touring Company
results.brief_description: It’s a rainy day and the Hooley Dooleys and their friends Russell the Muscly Kangaroo and Tickle the Doodat are disappointed because they can’t go to the park. Things don’t turn out too badly when they decide to put on a pretend concert in Tickle’s playroom, and they each take it in turns to either entertain or be part of the audience. Features the following songs; “We are the Hooley Dooleys”, “Hello you’ve got the rhythm”, “Ten fingers splashing in the puddles”, “Police car”, “Peek-a-boo ping pong ball”, “Kangaroo”, “Hands and feet sailing”, “The Hooley Dooley’s ball”, “Photograph diddley dee”, “Mowing”, “If I was”, “Drums”, and “Everybody”.

results.title: The Honeymooners
results.creator_credit: Frank Satenstein, Jack Hurdle, CBS and Jackie Gleason Enterprises
results.brief_description: The Honeymooners was a popular television comedy that started as a sketch show and due to its success was produced as a series. The live show was set in a Brooklyn apartment focusing on two lower middle class neighbouring couples trying to make their lives better. The main character Ralph (Jackie Gleason), a bus driver, is constantly at loggerheads with his wife, Alice (Audrey Meadows) who always make up by the end of the show. This video presentation includes one episode, “TV or not TV” and a montage tribute of the show presenting highlights and memorable moments. The episode shows what happens when the couples decide to jointly own a television set and the strains it places on their friendship. Interestingly “The Flintstones” cartoon was based on the characters from “The Honeymooners” placing them in a pre-historic setting.

results.title: The Holy Year of 1950
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: St Peter’s Basilica setting for an inspiring series of religious functions in 1950. Pilgrims on their way to Rome attend the opening of the Holy Year 1950. Thousands of pilgrims attend open air mass in St Peter’s Square with Pope Pirest 12th. Shows the art and architecture of Rome.

results.title: The Holden Story
results.brief_description: The Holden Story traces the company’s history from its earliest days as a mass producer of harness to the Australian Boer War contingent through to the latest developments in automotive factories which will change the face of tomorrow’s industry. “The Holden Story” is a story of optimism and depression, national pride and international competition. Rated: G
